sorcer.core.context

Class ArrayContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<String,T>
        • sorcer.core.context.ServiceContext
          • sorcer.core.context.ArrayContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Remote, Map, AssociativeContext, Context, Contexter, Evaluation, Identifiable, IndexedContext, Invocation, Mappable, Revaluation

    public class ArrayContext
extends ServiceContext
implements IndexedContext
    The Array dataContext has an array like access to a service dataContext. Accessing and setting dataContext values is done via integer indices. Implicit dataContext paths describe i-th element of "array" and are used by the following getters and setters (where: v - value, c - comment, d - description, i - input, o - output) as follows:
    1. the value of the i-th element: by v(i) and the setter v(i, obj);
      implicit path: array/[i]/value
    2. the comment of the i-th element: by vc(i) and the setter vc(i, comment);
      implicit path: array/[i]/comment
    3. the description of the i-th element: by vd(i) and the setter vd(i, description);
      implicit path: array/[i]/description
    4. the input value of the i-th element: by iv(i) and the setter iv(i, obj);
      implicit path: array/in/[i]/value
    5. the comment of the i-th element: by ivc(i) and the setter ivc(i, comment);
      implicit path: array/in/[i]/comment
    6. the description of the i-th element: by ivd(i) and the setter ivd(i, description);
      implicit path: array/in/[i]/description
    7. the output value of the i-th element: by ov(i) and the setter ov(i, obj);
      implicit path: array/out/[i]/value
    8. the comment of the i-th element: by ovc(i) and the setter ovc(i, comment);
      implicit path: array/out/[i]/comment
    9. the description of the i-th element: by ovd(i) and the setter ovd(i, description);
      implicit path: array/out/[i]/description
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
